column4: how do i figure out which version of l-ubuntu i have? how do i upgrade it? is it safe/effective to upgrade?
open terminal: lsb_release -a
what for?
for what reason?
how will it enhance?
there is no root password, therefore nobody can login with it
in ubuntu, there is no root password.
okay, sudo doesn't use a root password, it uses your password
you can go to system->administration->users & groups and change it there
you asked for it to be done from the gui.
sudo passwd  <-- that's all you need
sudo passwd sebastian
are you confused yet? I'm sorry, but 'passwd' by itself is all you need. sorry for the bad info above.

i already changed the password thanks, now the problem is this, when i am on the gui and click on my root only folder it says access denied, and what i want it to do is prompt and ask for the password
you'll just have to explain the whole thing, I don't understand 'root folder' you say one thing and mean another
so that'd be a feature request of pcmanfm then
you could possibly make a shortcut key-combo to do it
ok, problem is i amon lubuntu
yeah, you'll need to figure out how to do that then
it's only lxde, shouldn't be too terribly difficult to figure out
you should say that you're a noob in the first place, next time.
will do next time
